author: @Eserr7856

comment:
Innovators of breakthrough technology usually make the most naïve assumptions about how their technology will be used, and there is nothing surprising about such an observation.  Of course they are optimistic and positive about the wonderful new uses the technology will be applied to.   

But market forces and powerful commercial and political interests will drive how the technology will be used, and these forces are seldom guided by better angels.  Most often, we do the right thing only after exhausting all other options.

Can we afford to take that course with this technology?

comment:
I am a cult survivor, low income single father who is coparenting and have my fair share of mental health problems. While I am aware to not just blindly follow or do whatever chat GPT says, I cannot put into words how thankful I am to have such a resource at my disposal! It helps me consider balanced alternate perspectives, helps my write  empathetic and cooperative emails to my ex wife in relation to caring for our kids. It helps nabigate challenging social situations and come up with actionable and healthy strategies!
Thank you sooo much! While the risks are immense please know the impact for good this technology has is worth the challenge.
Much love and heartfelt thanks!! ❤

comment:
Non-dual philosophy should be how it is calibrated. Advaita Vedanta or non-duality is considered as the columination of knowledge. All knowledge should come under this umbrella. It's neutral in the sense that contemporary language can be used to  clarify how we as organisms fit into reality and how to gauge reality with a sound mind.  It can or will eventually serve as a backbone to read between the lines of religions and modern science. 

The problem I've seen with some religious biased people is that they have used it to give more affirmation to what is actually dangerous ideoligy. 

The mere fact that it can make jokes about jesus but not about another prophet as not to cause religious upheavel while their main book mentions isa 94 times and that other prophet only 4 times and not get riled up about jesus jokes is a really messed up double standard and all that while the archeoligy, ancient language experts, proffessors of uniniversities have laid bare so much info online that steers away from the standard accepted narrative.

So yeah, being protective is fine to a degree, but double standards by AI that keep facts away or credit already biased people. If ai is taking away jobs, then hate preachers shouldn't be keeping their jobs either

comment: At 18:00 or so talking about asking gpt to make two positive statements of equal length about two opposite people. That’s probably not clear enough parameters. Most of those would be about impossible to accomplish. Perhaps that is why it failed.

comment: The problem is limiting the UI to a chatbot-like interface for such a complex process that is what makes the process absolutely opaque... If a prompt triggers filers or algoritmic processes over the response of the network, the system should show that to the user in separate interface UI elements, not just the verbal response... But that's just an example of many things that could be happening there under the hood of that misplaced minimalism of ChatGPT's interface. Complex things should have complex UIs, at least until they are very very final-user-ready.

author: @caseyjuniordavis

comment: I think the hierarchy will be: The AI collects the data and says, "This is what I've determined, and these are the actions I will take in alignment with these determinations." It will then present it to us in a way we can see/interpret (like a UI or/and voice-narrated). Then the AI will go to us for validation of the action, just like how we as humans get our validation from some higher, transcendent validation (such as God). In other words, we will cause AI to give us what we need so that we can determine if we want to press the "execute," "go," or "play" buttons. No human wants to be bossed around by an AI, and if you do, then you have a problem that you need to fix.
author: @itslitgamestv6827
